revised_title: Investigating Polypeptide Chain Configurations in Crystalline Proteins
tldr: The authors conducted X-ray studies on crystalline proteins, focusing on myoglobin and hemoglobin, to investigate the configurations of polypeptide chains. They found evidence for folded chains with a repeat distance of about 5.1 Å, containing three amino acid residues per repeat. This research provided insights into the structure of proteins and laid the foundation for further studies on protein folding and structure determination.
